page.title: 15NEW ABBEY - LOCAL HISTORY(2)
page.content: Sweetheart Abbey was founded in 1273 by Lady Devorgilla,a daughter of Alan, Lord of Galloway and the widow of John Balliol. This noble lady had the heart of her husband embalmed and placed in an ivory casket which accompanied her everywhere. The Abbey was occupied by Cistercian monks who farmed the land, and bred horses,cattle and sheep. It was called the "new" abbey because of its sister abbey at Dundrennan. When Lady Devorgilla died in 1289 the casket was buried with her and the monks renamed the abbey Dulce Cor, the Abbey of Sweet Heart. After the Reformation the monks were dispersed and the abbey gradually fell into ruin,a process hastened by a huge fire sometime during the 18th century. Today the ruined Abbey dominates the village just as it did in the past.
